examples.sentence: ですか - Direct questions asking others
だろうか - Wondering, rhetorical questions, self-questioning
Expects an answer from the listener
Often used in writing or narration
Can be used when asking someone
でしょう expressions - Probability and politeness
だろう casual form - Casual probability
かもしれない - Expressing possibility
Rhetorical questions - Questions not expecting answers

sections.heading: Overview
sections.content:
ですか and だろうか are both used to ask questions, but they have very different nuances and uses:

ですか - Direct questions asking others だろうか - Wondering, rhetorical questions, self-questioning

明日は雨ですか？ "Will it rain tomorrow?" (asking someone) 明日は雨だろうか？ "I wonder if it will rain tomorrow?" (pondering)

children.heading: Basic Usage
children.content:
Used when directly asking someone for information:

これは何ですか？ "What is this?" どこに行きますか？ "Where are you going?" わかりますか？ "Do you understand?" いくらですか？ "How much is it?"

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Expects an answer from the listener Polite and direct Used in conversations The asker genuinely doesn't know

children.heading: Common Situations
children.content: お名前は何ですか？ "What is your name?" これでいいですか？ "Is this okay?" 何時に始まりますか？ "What time does it start?" どうしましたか？ "What happened?"

children.heading: Basic Usage
children.content:
Used when wondering about something, often without expecting an answer:

彼は来るだろうか？ "I wonder if he'll come?" これで大丈夫だろうか？ "I wonder if this is okay?" 本当だろうか？ "I wonder if it's true?" どうすればいいだろうか？ "I wonder what I should do?"

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Self-questioning or rhetorical More literary or formal Often used in writing or narration Expresses doubt or uncertainty May not expect an answer

children.heading: ですか - Seeking Information
children.content: 明日の天気はどうですか？ "How's tomorrow's weather?" (asking someone) ↓ Expects: "晴れです" or "雨です"

children.heading: だろうか - Wondering
children.content: 明日の天気はどうだろうか？ "I wonder how tomorrow's weather will be?" ↓ Not necessarily expecting an answer

sections.heading: でしょうか - Middle Ground
sections.content:
でしょうか is more polite than だろうか and can be used in conversation:

これでいいでしょうか？ "Would this be alright?" (polite inquiry) 雨が降るでしょうか？ "Do you think it will rain?" (polite wondering) 大丈夫でしょうか？ "Will it be okay?" (concerned question)

children.heading: Usage Context
children.content: More polite than ですか Can be used when asking someone Shows uncertainty or seeking reassurance Common in business/formal settings

children.heading: In Narration/Writing
children.content:
Common in essays, novels, and formal writing:

人生とは何だろうか？ "What is life?" これが正しい答えだろうか？ "Is this the correct answer?" 彼の言葉は本当だろうか？ "Are his words true?"

children.heading: Internal Monologue
children.content: A: (考えている) "Thinking..." 明日までに終わるだろうか... "I wonder if I'll finish by tomorrow..." 彼女は怒っているだろうか... "I wonder if she's angry..."

children.heading: Rhetorical Questions
children.content: これが愛と言えるだろうか？ "Can this be called love?" 本当にそれでいいのだろうか？ "Is that really okay?" 誰がこんなことをしたのだろうか？ "Who could have done such a thing?"

children.heading: Most Formal
children.content: 〜でございますか？ "Is it...?" (very formal) よろしいでしょうか？ "Would it be alright?" (very polite)

children.heading: Standard Polite
children.content: 〜ですか？ "Is it...?" 〜でしょうか？ "Is it...?" (polite wondering)

children.heading: Neutral/Literary
children.content: 〜だろうか？ "I wonder if...?" 〜であろうか？ "Could it be...?" (very formal/literary)

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 〜かな？ "I wonder...?" 〜だろう？ "Probably...?" / "Right?"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using だろうか to ask someone directly
children.content: Awkward: 名前は何だろうか？ (to someone) ⚠️ Better: お名前は何ですか？ ✓ "What is your name?" だろうか sounds like you're pondering, not asking!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using ですか for internal thoughts
children.content: Unnatural: (心の中で) 大丈夫ですか？ ⚠️ Better: (心の中で) 大丈夫だろうか？ ✓ "I wonder if it's okay?" (thinking to oneself)

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong politeness level
children.content: Too casual: 先生、これでいいだろう？ ❌ Better: 先生、これでいいでしょうか？ ✓ "Teacher, would this be alright?"

children.heading: だろうか Can Be a Real Question
children.content:
In formal speeches or presentations:

これは正しいと言えるだろうか？ "Can we say this is correct?" (to audience) 我々はどうすべきだろうか？ "What should we do?" (to group)

children.heading: ですか Can Express Surprise
children.content:
With certain intonation:

本当ですか？！ "Really?!" (surprised) そうですか... "Is that so..." (skeptical)

children.heading: かな (casual wondering)
children.content: 大丈夫かな？ "I wonder if it's okay?" 来るかな？ "I wonder if they'll come?" できるかな？ "I wonder if I can do it?"

children.heading: かしら (feminine, old-fashioned)
children.content: 本当かしら？ "I wonder if it's true?" どうしたのかしら？ "I wonder what happened?"

children.heading: のだろうか (explanatory wondering)
children.content: なぜ来なかったのだろうか？ "Why didn't they come, I wonder?" どうなるのだろうか？ "What will happen, I wonder?"

children.heading: Example 1: Direct Question (ですか)
children.content: A: すみません、これはいくらですか？ "Excuse me, how much is this?" B: 2000円です "It's 2000 yen" A: カードは使えますか？ "Can I use a card?" B: はい、使えます "Yes, you can"

children.heading: Example 2: Wondering (だろうか)
children.content: (独り言) "Thinking to oneself" 明日は晴れるだろうか... "I wonder if it will be sunny tomorrow..." 試験に合格できるだろうか... "I wonder if I can pass the exam..." 彼は来るだろうか... "I wonder if he'll come..."

children.heading: Example 3: Polite Inquiry (でしょうか)
children.content: A: こちらでよろしいでしょうか？ "Would this be alright?" B: はい、大丈夫です "Yes, that's fine" A: 明日までに仕上がるでしょうか？ "Will it be finished by tomorrow?" B: はい、間に合います "Yes, we'll make it in time"

children.heading: Conversation (Use ですか)
children.content: 今日は何曜日ですか？ "What day is today?" 駅はどこですか？ "Where is the station?" この本は面白いですか？ "Is this book interesting?"

children.heading: Writing/Narration (Use だろうか)
children.content: 人類の未来はどうなるだろうか？ "What will become of humanity's future?" これが最後の機会だろうか？ "Is this the last chance?" 彼の決断は正しかっただろうか？ "Was his decision correct?"

children.heading: Business Email (Use でしょうか)
children.content: こちらの提案でよろしいでしょうか？ "Would this proposal be acceptable?" ご都合はいかがでしょうか？ "How would this be convenient for you?" 明日お伺いしてもよろしいでしょうか？ "Would it be alright to visit tomorrow?"

children.heading: Present/Future
children.content: ですか: 明日来ますか？ "Will you come tomorrow?" だろうか: 明日来るだろうか？ "I wonder if they'll come tomorrow?"

children.heading: Past
children.content: ですか: 昨日行きましたか？ "Did you go yesterday?" だろうか: 昨日行っただろうか？ "I wonder if they went yesterday?"

children.heading: ですか (asking someone)
children.content: 誰ですか？ "Who is it?" 何ですか？ "What is it?" どこですか？ "Where is it?" いつですか？ "When is it?"

children.heading: だろうか (wondering)
children.content: 誰だろうか？ "I wonder who it is?" 何だろうか？ "I wonder what it is?" どこだろうか？ "I wonder where it is?" いつだろうか？ "I wonder when it is?"

children.heading: ですか - Neutral Question
children.content: 本当ですか？ "Is it true?" 間違っていますか？ "Is it wrong?"

children.heading: だろうか - Expressing Doubt
children.content: 本当だろうか？ "I wonder if it's true?" (doubtful) 間違っているだろうか？ "Could I be wrong?" (uncertain)

children.heading: でしょうか - Polite Uncertainty
children.content: 本当でしょうか？ "Could it be true?" (polite doubt) 間違っているでしょうか？ "Might I be mistaken?" (humble)

children.heading: Essay Writing (だろうか)
children.content: この問題をどう解決すべきだろうか？ "How should we solve this problem?" 教育の真の目的とは何だろうか？ "What is the true purpose of education?" 現代社会における幸福とは何を意味するだろうか？ "What does happiness mean in modern society?"

children.heading: Academic Writing (であろうか)
children.content:
Very formal, literary:

これは正しい解釈と言えるであろうか？ "Could this be called a correct interpretation?" このデータは信頼できるものであろうか？ "Could this data be considered reliable?"

children.heading: かな - Most Common Casual
children.content:
大丈夫かな？ "I wonder if it's okay?" できるかな？ "I wonder if I can do it?" 来るかな？ "I wonder if they'll come?"

Gender-neutral, widely used.

children.heading: だろう - Casual Wondering
children.content:
本当だろう？ "It's true, right?" 行くだろう？ "You'll go, right?" 知ってるだろう？ "You know, right?"

More assertive than かな.

children.heading: かしら - Feminine, Old-fashioned
children.content:
大丈夫かしら？ "I wonder if it's okay?" (feminine) 来るかしら？ "I wonder if they'll come?" (feminine)

Less common in modern speech.

children.heading: ですか (Negative Questions)
children.content: 行かないですか？ "Won't you go?" 食べませんか？ "Won't you eat?" わからないですか？ "Don't you understand?"

children.heading: だろうか (Negative Wondering)
children.content: 行かないだろうか？ "I wonder if they won't go?" わからないだろうか？ "Could they not understand?" 間に合わないだろうか？ "I wonder if we won't make it in time?"

children.heading: 〜だろうか、いや〜だろう
children.content:
Answering one's own question:

彼は来るだろうか？いや、来ないだろう "Will he come? No, he probably won't" これで大丈夫だろうか？いや、もっと必要だろう "Is this enough? No, probably need more"

children.heading: 〜ではないだろうか (suggestion)
children.content:
Suggesting something tentatively:

これが原因ではないだろうか？ "Couldn't this be the cause?" もっと良い方法があるのではないだろうか？ "Might there be a better method?"

children.heading: 〜だろうか、〜だろうか (multiple wonderings)
children.content: 彼は来るだろうか？来ないだろうか？ "Will he come? Won't he come?" どうしようか？行こうか？やめようか？ "What should I do? Should I go? Should I stop?"

children.heading: Daily Conversation → ですか
children.content: 今何時ですか？ "What time is it now?" ご飯食べましたか？ "Did you eat?" 疲れていますか？ "Are you tired?"

children.heading: Internal Thoughts → だろうか/かな
children.content: (心の中で) どうしようかな... "What should I do..." 大丈夫だろうか... "I wonder if it's okay..." 間に合うかな... "I wonder if I'll make it..."

children.heading: Business/Formal → でしょうか
children.content: ご確認いただけますでしょうか？ "Could you please confirm?" こちらでお間違いないでしょうか？ "Is this correct?" ご都合はいかがでしょうか？ "How is your schedule?"

sections.heading: Comparison Chart
sections.content: | Pattern | Formality | Usage | Expects Answer | | ---------- | --------------- | ---------------- | -------------- | | ですか | Polite | Direct questions | Yes | | でしょうか | Very polite | Polite inquiry | Usually yes | | だろうか | Formal/Literary | Wondering | Usually no | | だろう | Casual | Confirmation | Sometimes | | かな | Casual | Wondering | No | | かしら | Feminine | Wondering | No |

children.heading: With ですか
children.content: そうですか "Is that so?" 本当ですか？ "Really?" 大丈夫ですか？ "Are you okay?" いいですか？ "Is it okay?"

children.heading: With だろうか
children.content: そうだろうか "I wonder if that's so" 本当だろうか "I wonder if it's true" どうなるだろうか "I wonder what will happen" 何ができるだろうか "What can be done, I wonder"

children.heading: With でしょうか
children.content: そうでしょうか "Do you think so?" 本当でしょうか "Could it be true?" よろしいでしょうか "Would it be alright?" 大丈夫でしょうか "Will it be okay?"

children.heading: ですか - End of Sentence Only
children.content: これは何ですか？ ✓ "What is this?" これは、ですか、何？ ❌

children.heading: だろうか - Can Appear Mid-Sentence
children.content:
In complex sentences:

彼が来るだろうか、来ないだろうか、それが問題だ "Whether he'll come or not, that's the question" これで良いだろうかと考えている "I'm thinking whether this is good"

children.heading: Direct Questions (ですか)
children.content: お名前は何ですか？ "What is your name?" どこから来ましたか？ "Where did you come from?" 日本語が話せますか？ "Can you speak Japanese?" これはいくらですか？ "How much is this?"

children.heading: Wondering (だろうか)
children.content: 明日は晴れるだろうか？ "I wonder if it will be sunny tomorrow?" これで間に合うだろうか？ "I wonder if this will be enough?" 彼は何を考えているのだろうか？ "What could he be thinking?" 人生とは何だろうか？ "What is life?"

children.heading: Polite Inquiry (でしょうか)
children.content: こちらでよろしいでしょうか？ "Would this be alright?" お時間はございますでしょうか？ "Do you have time?" もう一度説明していただけますでしょうか？ "Could you explain once more?" 来週でも大丈夫でしょうか？ "Would next week be okay?"

children.heading: Casual Wondering (かな)
children.content: 明日晴れるかな？ "I wonder if it'll be sunny tomorrow?" できるかな？ "I wonder if I can do it?" 誰かな？ "I wonder who it is?" どうしようかな？ "What should I do?"

children.heading: Use ですか when:
children.content: Asking someone directly Having a conversation Expecting an answer Being polite and clear

children.heading: Use だろうか when:
children.content: Wondering to yourself Writing essays or narratives Asking rhetorical questions Being literary or philosophical

children.heading: Use でしょうか when:
children.content: Being very polite In business situations Showing uncertainty politely Seeking reassurance

children.heading: Use かな when:
children.content: Speaking casually Wondering out loud Talking to friends Not expecting an answer
